articles.headline: A Camera That Frees Your Face
articles.snippet: After a breakthrough by Sony, serious photographers can no longer snort at the idea of composing shots on a screen.
articles.abstract: After a breakthrough by Sony, serious photographers can no longer snort at the idea of composing shots on a screen.
articles.lead_paragraph: Just by looking at it, you’d never guess that Sony’s new Alpha A300 digital camera represents a huge technical breakthrough. To discover what it is, you need a tour of its innards. Keep hands and feet inside the tram at all times.

articles.headline: Ambac Disappoints Market With a Plan to Raise Cash
articles.snippet: A bid to bolster the Ambac Financial Group, the troubled bond insurance company, fell flat on Wednesday, sending the company’s stock tumbling.
articles.abstract: A bid to bolster the Ambac Financial Group, the troubled bond insurance company, fell flat on Wednesday, sending the company’s stock tumbling.
articles.lead_paragraph: A bid to bolster the Ambac Financial Group, the troubled bond insurance company, fell flat on Wednesday, sending the company’s stock tumbling 20 percent and disrupting the broader stock market.

articles.headline: Clinton Success Alters Delegate Race’s Dynamic
articles.snippet: After Tuesday’s primary victories for Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, her focus is momentum; for her Democratic rival, Senator Barack Obama, it is math.
articles.abstract: After Tuesday’s primary victories for Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton, her focus is momentum; for her Democratic rival, Senator Barack Obama, it is math.
articles.lead_paragraph: Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton’s victories in the primaries on Tuesday barely dented Senator Barack Obama’s lead in delegates, but they seemed to slow the Democratic Party establishment’s move in his direction while giving her campaign time to try to turn the race in her favor.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Carl Hulse

articles.headline: Turning Glare Into Watts
articles.snippet: The world appears to be on the verge of a boom in a little-known but promising type of solar power.
articles.abstract: The world appears to be on the verge of a boom in a little-known but promising type of solar power.
articles.lead_paragraph: BOULDER CITY, Nev.  At first, as he adjusted pumps and checked temperatures, Aaron Boucher looked like any technician in the control room of an electrical plant. Then he rushed to the window and scanned the sky, to check his fuel supply.

articles.headline: In Europe, Central Banking Is Different
articles.snippet: Unlike the Fed, the European Central bank is skeptical of the notion that inflation automatically falls when growth cools, and it has a mandate to keep prices stable above all else.
articles.abstract: Unlike the Fed, the European Central bank is skeptical of the notion that inflation automatically falls when growth cools, and it has a mandate to keep prices stable above all else.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT  On Jan. 21, the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben S. Bernanke, abruptly canceled plans to travel to New York so he could stay in Washington to engineer the largest one-day reduction of interest rates in recent times.

articles.headline: Lesson of Defeat: Obama Comes Out Punching
articles.snippet: After appearing nearly invincible last week, Barack Obama now faces questions about whether he can win states vital to a Democratic victory in November.
articles.abstract: After appearing nearly invincible last week, Barack Obama now faces questions about whether he can win states vital to a Democratic victory in November.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Senator Barack Obama woke up on Wednesday talking of his delegate lead and of taking the fight to Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton. But after defeats in two of the most populous states, he also sounded like a chastened candidate in search of his lost moment.
articles.byline: By Michael Powell and Jeff Zeleny

articles.headline: Fidelity to Pay U.S. to End Case Over Gifts
articles.snippet: The company agreed to pay $8 million to settle regulatory claims that current and former employees accepted improper gifts in exchange for business.
articles.abstract: The company agreed to pay $8 million to settle regulatory claims that current and former employees accepted improper gifts in exchange for business.
articles.lead_paragraph: Days at Wimbledon. Nights at U2 concerts. Flights aboard the Concorde.

articles.headline: President Fails to Budge OPEC on Production
articles.snippet: Record oil prices are suddenly creating the sharpest tensions in years between the oil cartel and the U.S.
articles.abstract: Record oil prices are suddenly creating the sharpest tensions in years between the oil cartel and the U.S.
articles.lead_paragraph: OPEC on Wednesday rebuffed calls from President Bush to increase oil output, instead citing “mismanagement” of the American economy as a major factor driving prices up.

articles.headline: Cyber-Rebels in Cuba Defy State’s Limits
articles.snippet: A growing underground network of young people has been spreading news the official state media try to suppress.
articles.abstract: A growing underground network of young people has been spreading news the official state media try to suppress.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAVANA  A growing underground network of young people armed with computer memory sticks, digital cameras and clandestine Internet hookups has been mounting some challenges to the Cuban government in recent months, spreading news that the official state media try to suppress.

articles.headline: New Generation Gap as Older Addicts Seek Help
articles.snippet: Across the country, substance abuse centers are reaching out to older addicts who have historically been ignored.
articles.abstract: Across the country, substance abuse centers are reaching out to older addicts who have historically been ignored.
articles.lead_paragraph: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla.  All is peaceful and orderly on the older adult unit at Hanley Center, where substance abusers over the age of 55 are spared the noisy swagger of addicts half their age across the campus.
